question: Which of the following statements is incorrect about the Inter-State Council?
option1: The council is mandated to inquire into and give recommendations on disputes which may arise between states
option2: Article 263 of the Constitution provides for the establishment of an Inter-State Council
option3: Prime Minister is the chairperson of the council
option4: The council was formed based on the recommendations of the Punchhi Commission
answer: The council was formed based on the recommendations of the Punchhi Commission
explanation: <u>First statement is correct</u>. The Inter-State Council is mandated to inquire into and give recommendations on disputes which may arise between states. <u>Second statement is correct</u>. Article 263 of the Constitution provides for the establishment of an Inter-State Council. Third statement is correct. Prime Minister is the chairperson of the council. <u>Fourth Statement is incorrect</u>. It was established by Presidential Order dated 28th May, 1990 on recommendation of Sarkaria Commission. Chief Ministers of all states and Union territories having legislative assemblies will also be members of the council. Besides this, Union Ministers selected by the Prime Minister also become a part of the council.
